DataElement.preferredName: Reverse Transcriptase-Polymerase Chain Reaction Genetic Marker Assessment Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: a description of a gene abnormality associated with cancer evaluated in a DNA sample by a technique which detects a defined genetic sequence by transcribing RNA strands into a DNA complement.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Reverse Transcriptase-Polymerase Chain Reaction Genetic Marker Assessment
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: related to the evaluation to identify genes associated with cancer using a technique to detect a defined genetic sequence in a DNA sample by transcribing RNA strands into a DNA complement.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: RT-PCR is short for reverse transcriptase-polymerase chain reaction. It is a technique in which an RNA strand is first transcribed into a DNA complement and then subjected to PCR amplification. Transcribing an RNA strand into a DNA complement is termed reverse transcription and is done by the enzyme reverse transcriptase. (from Wikipedia)

Concepts.definition: A laboratory procedure in which an RNA strand is first transcribed into a DNA complement and then subjected to PCR amplification. Transcribing an RNA strand into a DNA complement is termed reverse transcription and is done by the enzyme reverse transcriptase.

Property.preferredDefinition: Alterations in DNA that may indicate an increased risk of developing a specific disease or disorder.:Examination of the body by auscultation, palpation, percussion, inspection, and olfaction.  (Taber's)

Concepts.definition: A segment of DNA with an identifiable physical location on a chromosome and whose inheritance can be followed.

A systemic evaluation of the body and its functions using visual inspection, palpation, percussion and auscultation. The purpose is to determine the presence or absence of physical signs of disease or abnormality for an individual's health assessment.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Reverse Transcriptase-Polymerase Chain Reaction Genetic Marker Assessment Type
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: a description of a gene abnormality associated with cancer evaluated in a DNA sample by a technique which detects a defined genetic sequence by transcribing RNA strands into a DNA complement.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Be specific about something; define clearly.: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Concepts.definition: Be specific about something; define clearly.
Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Concept annotation added for UPitt/TCGA.  Ylu, 01/29/2015.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Expression of a fusion protein that results from a t(8;21)(q22;q22) translocation, which involves the human genes RUNX1 and RUNX1T1 and is associated with acute myeloid leukemia.

Concepts.definition: Expression of a fusion protein that results from a t(8;21)(q22;q22) translocation, which involves the human genes RUNX1 and RUNX1T1 and is associated with acute myeloid leukemia.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Bcr/abl is the gene rearrangement that is associated primarily with the disease chronic myelogenous leukemia and less frequently with acute lymphoblastic leukemia.  This rearrangement results in the formation of the BCR-ABL1 fusion protein.

Concepts.definition: Bcr/abl is the gene rearrangement that is associated primarily with the disease chronic myelogenous leukemia and less frequently with acute lymphoblastic leukemia.  This rearrangement results in the formation of the BCR-ABL1 fusion protein.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Expression of a fusion protein with an apparent molecular weight of 190 kilodaltons that results from a fusion of the human genes BCR and ABL1.

Concepts.definition: Expression of a fusion protein with an apparent molecular weight of 190 kilodaltons that results from a fusion of the human genes BCR and ABL1.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Expression of a fusion protein with an apparent molecular weight of 210 kilodaltons that results from a fusion of the human genes BCR and ABL1.

Concepts.definition: Expression of a fusion protein with an apparent molecular weight of 210 kilodaltons that results from a fusion of the human genes BCR and ABL1.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Expression of a fusion protein with an apparent molecular weight of 230 kilodaltons that results from a fusion of the human genes BCR and ABL1.

Concepts.definition: Expression of a fusion protein with an apparent molecular weight of 230 kilodaltons that results from a fusion of the human genes BCR and ABL1.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Expression of a fusion protein containing the helix-loop-helix domain encoded by the human ETV6 gene and the DNA-binding and transactivation domains encoded by the human RUNX1 gene as a result of a t(12;21)(p13; q22) translocation.

Concepts.definition: Expression of a fusion protein containing the helix-loop-helix domain encoded by the human ETV6 gene and the DNA-binding and transactivation domains encoded by the human RUNX1 gene as a result of a t(12;21)(p13; q22) translocation.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Expression of a fusion protein that results from a fusion of the human genes PML and RARA.

Concepts.definition: Expression of a fusion protein that results from a fusion of the human genes PML and RARA.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A fusion protein encoded by a t(15;17) translocation, which involves the human genes ZBTB16 and RARA and is characteristic of acute promyelocytic leukemia. It is a transcriptional repressor with both gain-of-function and dominant-negative properties, resulting in transcriptional repression of retinoic acid and non-retinoic acid target genes and culminating in differentiation arrest.

Concepts.definition: A fusion protein encoded by a t(15;17) translocation, which involves the human genes ZBTB16 and RARA and is characteristic of acute promyelocytic leukemia. It is a transcriptional repressor with both gain-of-function and dominant-negative properties, resulting in transcriptional repression of retinoic acid and non-retinoic acid target genes and culminating in differentiation arrest.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Expression of a fusion protein that results from a t(1;19)(q23;p13) translocation, which involves the human genes E2A and PBX1 and is associated with B lymphoblastic leukemias.

Concepts.definition: Expression of a fusion protein that results from a t(1;19)(q23;p13) translocation, which involves the human genes E2A and PBX1 and is associated with B lymphoblastic leukemias.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Expression of a fusion protein that results from a t(3;21)(q26;q22) translocation, which involves the human genes MECOM and RUNX1 and is associated with chronic myelogenous leukemia.

Concepts.definition: Expression of a fusion protein that results from a t(3;21)(q26;q22) translocation, which involves the human genes MECOM and RUNX1 and is associated with chronic myelogenous leukemia.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Expression of a fusion protein that results from the insertion mutation ins(5;11)(q31;q13q23), which involves the human genes KMT2A and AFF1 and is associated with acute lymphoblastic leukemia.

Concepts.definition: Expression of a fusion protein that results from the insertion mutation ins(5;11)(q31;q13q23), which involves the human genes KMT2A and AFF1 and is associated with acute lymphoblastic leukemia.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Expression of a fusion protein that results from a t(9;11)(p22;q23) translocation, which involves the human genes KMT2A and MLLT3 and is associated with many leukemias.

Concepts.definition: Expression of a fusion protein that results from a t(9;11)(p22;q23) translocation, which involves the human genes KMT2A and MLLT3 and is associated with many leukemias.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Expression of a fusion protein that results from an inversion or translocation, which involves the human genes CBFB and MYH11 and is associated with acute myeloid leukemias.

Concepts.definition: Expression of a fusion protein that results from an inversion or translocation, which involves the human genes CBFB and MYH11 and is associated with acute myeloid leukemias.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Concepts.definition: Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
